definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: decline, bend down, encamp (Aram. h.no0 to aim at, incline towards, reach; Zinj. [[מחנת]] cstr. camp, Inscr. Panammu:13. 16. 17; Ar. h.ana0 bend, curve, bend down; As. mûnu, mênu and tênû, couch, mânîtu, house, Zim:BP 44, 45 Dl in Zim:117)—
decline, of day drawing to its close [[חֲנוֹת הַיּוֹם]] Ju Jdg 19:9 (‖´[[רָפָה הַיּ]] [[לַעֲרוֹב]]; also ´[[נְטוֹת הַיּ]] v:Jdg 19:8; [[הַיּוֹם רַד מְאׂד]] v:Jdg 19:11).
encamp (prop. verge toward, incline to, settle at, of goal of day's march):—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: of single nomad Ge 26:17 (J; sq. [[ב]]), Ge 33:18 (E; sq. [[אֶת־פני]]).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: of Israel at Exod. and in wilderness Ex 13:20 ([[ב]]) Ex 14:2 ([[לִפְנֵי]]), v:Ex 14:2 ([[עַל]]), + c. 80 t. (Hex. chiefly P); also (abs.) Nu 9:18, Nu 9:20, Nu 9:22, Nu 9:23 cf. Ezr 8:15; Ne 11:30 so they encamped (i.e. settled, or were settled) from Beersheba to the valley of Hinnom (‖[[ישׁבו]] v:Ne 11:25).

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: of armies: (1) Israel (conquering Canaan, etc.) Jos 4:19, Jos 5:10 + oft.; (2) Philistines 1Sa 4:1, 1Sa 13:16, 2Sa 23:23 +; usu. sq. [[ב]] loc. Nu 10:31, 1Sa 4:1, 1Sa 13:16, Jos 4:19, 1Sa 13:5 + 63 t. ([[וַיַּחֲנוּ בְ]] 2Sa 24:5 rd. [[וַיׇּחֵלּוּ מִן]] LXXL We Dr v. [[חלל]]); so of locusts in hedges (in sim.) Na 3:17; also sq. [[עַל]] = by, near Ex 14:2, Ex 14:9, Ex 15:27, Nu 1:52, Nu 2:2, Nu 2:5, Nu 2:12, Nu 2:27, Nu 3:29, Nu 3:35 ([[על ירך]]), Nu 33:10, Ju Jdg 7:1, 1Sa 4:1; [[על־פני השׂדה]] ([[על]] in diff. sense) 2Sa 11:11; sq. [[עַל]] also = against, encamp with hostile purpose Jos 10:5, Jos 10:31, Jos 10:34, Ju Jdg 6:4, Jdg 20:19, 1Sa 11:1, 2Sa 12:28, 1Ki 16:15, 2Ki 25:1, 2Ch 32:1, Je 50:29, Je 52:4, Ps 27:3; sq. [[אֶל־]] in same sense Jos 11:5; metaph. of God's hostility to apostate Jerusalem ([[על]]) Is 29:3; sq. also [[לְ]] = at, by Nu 2:34, Zec 9:8; [[שָׁס]]…[[אשׁר]] Ex 18:5, 1Sa 26:5; sq. [[סביב לְ]] for protection Nu 1:50, Nu 1:53, cf. metaph. Ps 34:8, but also hostility Job 19:12; also sq. other prep. and prep. phrases, e.g. [[מֵעֵבֶר]] Nu 21:13; [[מחוץ]] Nu 31:19; [[בין]] 1Sa 17:1; [[נגד]] 1Ki 20:27 etc.; sq. acc. loc. 2Sa 17:26; sq. sf. acc. with hostile sense [[חׂנׇ֑ךָ]] Ps 53:6; without prep. or noun foll., in sense of encamp, be or abide in encampment Nu 9:18, Nu 9:20, Nu 9:22, Nu 9:23, Ezr 8:15, 2Sa 11:11 +; poet. of David in Jerusalem, Is 29:1 city in which David fixed his camp.
